intro: Gratiola involucrata, commonly known as the narrowleaf pearly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open areas such as meadows and slopes. Gratiola involucrata is a member of the Campanulaceae family, known for its showy, bell-shaped flowers.
